intro: Sicyos longisetosus, commonly known as the long-hair burr gourd, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers, squash, and gourds. The plant is characterized by its large, lobed leaves and distinctive, spiny fruits that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. Sicyos longisetosus is often cultivated for its edible fruits, which have a mild, sweet flavor. Its botanical features make it an important species in both traditional agriculture and ecological studies.
